title: [Large-scale] Problem-Based Mathematics Project Design Utilizing Gamification

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Mathematical Concepts (Functions, Statistics, Calculus) and Digital Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment combining mathematical modeling for real-world problem-solving with gamification elements (scores, levels, feedback).

learning_goals: Real-world mathematical problems occurring in professional settings can be analyzed and solutions designed using a Problem-Based Learning (PBL) approach
Gamification elements (challenges, reward systems) can be utilized to motivate learners and encourage sustained engagement

In 4-member team projects, learners solve two job-related problems (e.g., production planning optimization, inventory management improvement) using mathematical modeling techniques (regression analysis, simulation, etc.), and submit a 5–7 page decision-making report achieving ≥80% fulfillment in three peer evaluation items (creativity, contribution, collaboration attitude) and four summative evaluation items (problem definition, modeling appropriateness, result interpretation, practicality).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
